properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 8 at 2:31PM CST until January 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
...Heavy Rain Possible Friday Through Friday Night...

The National Weather Service in Kansas City/Pleasant Hill has
issued a

* Flash Flood Watch for portions of central Missouri and west
central Missouri, including the following areas, in central
Missouri, Cooper, Howard, and Pettis. In west central
Missouri, Bates and Henry.

* From Friday morning through late Friday night

* Moderate to heavy rain will be possible through the day on
Friday, and should last into Saturday morning. One to three
inches of rain will be possible over a 24 hour period between
Friday morning through Friday night.

* Local creeks and streams could rise very quickly and area roads
could become covered with running water. Turn around do not
drown.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
